info.title: Discovery
info.description: The discovery API allows you to discover customers in the eToro network. It is important to note that only customers who have opted-in for discovery will be shown by this API

get.description: The search API allows you to filter customers according to periodic aggregate data. For a full explanation on the mechanics of filtering, ordering and paging, see this blog post

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The requested page number. Defaults to 1

parameters.name: Sort
parameters.description: The requested sort. Sorting may be applied to multiple columns. For descending order a '-' prefix should be used.

parameters.name: Fields
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of fields which should be returned

get.description: The discovery metadata API returns the values which can be queried

200.description:
The result is a vector of member descriptors which are returned by the search API. The following is the descriptor object
NamestringThe member name. The member will be part of the returned object in the search API, and will be used for filtering and ordering the results in the API
Display NamestringA human friendly name
DescriptionstringA description of the member
TypestringThe data type of the member. It may be on of the following: integer, number, string, datetime
GroupstringThe grouping of the member. The values may be: Demographics, Gain, Risk, copy, Trading and Engagement
OperationstringThe filtering operation which is applicable for this operation. The operation determines the way filtering can be applied. The valid values are: None, Equality, MinMax and In

examples.application/json:
[
  {
    "name": "UserName",
    "displayName": "Username",
    "description": "The username of the customer",
    "type": "string",
    "group": "Demographics",
    "operation": "None"
  },
  {
    "name": "WeeksSinceRegistration",
    "displayName": "Weeks Since Registration",
    "description": "Number of weeks since registration",
    "type": "integer",
    "group": "Demographics",
    "operation": "MinMax"
  }
]
